note: Minuscule "à μεν distendu" | Variant of the epsilon style characterized by thick vertical strokes, triangular α, θ in the shape of biblical majuscule, and featuring the ligature "distendu" of μεν and γεν. Initials and titles are written in epigraphische Auszeichnungsmajuskel
The lower writing runs parallel to the overtext
Each side preserves 22–23 lines of text arranged in a single column and spaced 6 mm apart

One folio of Sin. gr. 960 corresponds to a single folio of the original manuscript, the likely size of the original being 180x140 mm (though doubtless with some trimming of the height). The Schriftspiegel is approximately 125x95 mm. The outer margin measures 30 mm, the lower 24 mm, and the upper 14 mm
